title: Hawaii birthrate decrease affecting economy and population
text:
HONOLULU (AP) - Officials say a decreased birthrate in Hawaii has larger population and economic implications for the state now and in the future.

Hawaii Public Radio reported Monday that recent data show the number of babies born in Hawaii has been declining for a decade, which follows a national trend.

Hawaii’s current birthrate is 10% lower than in 2008.

The economic effects include reports by at least two Oahu hospitals of decreases in work shifts for maternity ward nurses and a reduction in new nurse hiring.

Officials say the decrease in the number of babies could also lead to a drop in the amount of Hawaii workers and taxpayers in the future.

Officials say the state’s population has decreased in recent years as the number of people leaving outpaces new arrivals.
